subject: Gardening
title: Community Gardens and Social Capital
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Community Gardens and Social Capital.

hook.text: Community gardens don't just grow vegetables. They grow trust, friendships, and social networks among strangers.

buildup.text: Shared garden spaces force interaction: negotiating plot boundaries, sharing tools, exchanging seeds and recipes.

discovery.text: Studies show neighborhoods with community gardens have lower crime rates, higher property values.

twist.text: The food is often secondary. The real harvest is social capitalâ€”bonds between people who'd otherwise never meet.

climax.text: Community gardens rebuild social fabric in fragmented cities. They're social infrastructure disguised as farming.

punchline.text: The real crop in community gardens is community itself.
